intro: Durandea pallida, commonly known as the pale durandea, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of South America. It is characterized by its small, pale yellow flowers and hairy, narrow leaves adapted to conserve water. The plant belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and it has a climbing habit with slender, twining stems. Its flowers are typically clustered in racemes and bloom during the dry season. Durandea pallida is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is well-suited to harsh, low-nutrient environments.
